long_desc: How does a country and a people become How have past events fashioned what we know today as France and the French What does it mean to be French   There is no doubt that the history of Muslims and Christians has influenced the modern discussions and circumstances that exist today and has contributed to the conception of what it means to be French. In this course, we will discuss how history shaped France and her relationship to the Muslim population. By studying the roots of MuslimChristian relations, we can understand the complexities and challenges of living in France today.   We will study literary texts such as Aucassin et Nicolette, examine the role of the Crusades, and investigate their longterm effects through the Algerian War. Side by side with history, we will examine the contemporary climate of MuslimChristian relationships in modern France through presentday events, changes in the law, and film to understand political changes and social situations. Multiple perspectives will be considered to understand the past, the present, and what the future may hold.
name: Becoming France: Constructing a National Mentality
base_name: Becoming France: Constructing a National Mentality
